intro: Acourtia nana, commonly known as the dwarf acourtia, is a small flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in dry, sunny conditions. Its flowers are small and white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters at the top of the stems. It is often found in coastal and inland desert environments, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small insects.
